data.title: Schedule of Upcoming Movie Musical Adaptations
data.text:
The following is a list of stage musicals announced to be adapted as films.

IN POST-PRODUCTION

WICKED

• Release Date: November 22, 2024 (Part 1); November 26, 2025 (Part 2)

• Production Company: Universal Pictures, Marc Platt Productions

• Screenplay: Winnie Holzman

• Director: Jon M. Chu

• Cast: Cynthia Erivo, Ariana Grande, Jonathan Bailey, Marissa Bode, Peter Dinklage, Jeff Goldblum, Ethan Slater, Michelle Yeoh

• An adaptation of Stephen Schwartz and Winnie Holzman's popular musical about the life of the Wicked Witch of the West.

• Trailer

• Latest Update: Listen to Cynthia Erivo Sing 'Defying Gravity' in New Wicked Trailer (7/26/2024)

KISS OF THE SPIDER WOMAN

• Production Company: Artists Equity, 1000 Eyes, Nuyorican Productions, Josephson Entertainment

• Screenplay: Bill Condon

• Director: Bill Condon

• Cast: Jennifer Lopez, Diego Luna, Tonatiuh

• A film adaptation of John Kander, Fred Ebb, and Terrence McNally's Tony Award-winning musical, based on the novel by Manuel Puig.

• Latest Update: Tonatiuh, Diego Luna Board Jennifer Lopez-Led Kiss of the Spider Woman Movie Musical (4/9/2024)

IN PRE-PRODUCTION

GIRL FROM THE NORTH COUNTRY

• Production Company: Blueprint Pictures

• Screenplay: Conor McPherson

• Director: Conor McPherson

• Cast: Olivia Colman, Chlöe Bailey, Tosin Cole, Woody Harrelson

• An adaptation of Conor McPherson's musical featuring the songs of Bob Dylan.

• Latest Update: Olivia Colman, Chlöe Bailey, Tosin Cole, Woody Harrelson Will Star in Girl From the North Country Film (2/6/2023)

IN DEVELOPMENT

THE 25TH ANNUAL PUTNAM COUNTY SPELLING BEE

• Producers: Walt Disney Pictures, Rideback

• Screenplay: TBA

• Director: TBA

• Cast: TBA

• An adaptation of William Finn and Rachel Sheinkin's musical about a middle school spelling bee.

• Latest Update: The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee Movie in the Works From Disney (4/23/2021)

BARE: A POP OPERA

• Producers: Hillary Butorac Weaver, Janet Billig Rich

• Screenplay: Kristin Hanggi

• Director: Kristin Hanggi

• Cast: TBA

• An adaptation of Jon Hartmere, Jr. and Damon Intrabartolo's musical about the struggles of two gay high school students at a Catholic boarding school.

• Latest Update: Bare: A Pop Opera Film Adaptation in the Works (1/2/2018)

BE MORE CHILL

• Production Company: 21 Laps, Berlanti Productions

• Screenplay: TBA

• Director: TBA

• Cast: TBA

• An adaptation of Joe Iconis and Joe Tracz's musical about a teenager who takes a pill that makes him more popular.

• Latest Update: Be More Chill, Headed to Broadway, Also Bound for the Big Screen (10/20/2018)

BEAUTIFUL: THE CAROLE KING MUSICAL

• Production Company: Sony Pictures, Playtone

• Screenplay: Lisa Cholodenko and Stuart Blumberg

• Director: Lisa Cholodenko

• Cast: TBA

• A film adaptation of the musical about the early life and career of singer/songwriter Carole King.

• Latest Update: Daisy Edgar-Jones Will Lead Beautiful Movie Musical as Carole King (12/15/2022)

BIG RIVER

• Screenplay: Douglas Lyons

• Director: TBA

• Cast: TBA

• A film adaptation of Roger Miller and William Hauptman's Tony Award-winning musical based on the Mark Twain novel Adventures of Huckleberry Finn.

• Latest Update: Douglas Lyons to Adapt Big River for the Big Screen (1/16/2024)

FLOWER DRUM SONG

• Production Company: Concord Originals, 3AD, Janet Yang Productions

• Screenplay: TBA

• Director: TBA

• Cast: TBA

• A new adaptation of Richard Rodgers, Oscar Hammerstein II, and Joseph Fields' 1958 musical based on the C.Y. Lee novel.

• Latest Update: Concord Developing New Film Re-Imagining of Flower Drum Song, More With New Originals Division (8/6/2021)

FOLLIES

• Production Company: BBC Films, Heyday Films

• Screenplay: TBA

• Director: Dominic Cooke

• Cast: TBA

• An adaptation of Stephen Sondheim and James Goldman's musical about a reunion of former follies girls.

• Latest Update: A Movie Adaptation of Follies Is in the Works; Dominic Cooke to Direct (11/14/2019)

GUYS AND DOLLS

• Production Company: TriStar Pictures

• Screenplay: TBA

• Director: Bill Condon

• Cast: TBA

• A new film adaptation of Frank Loesser, Abe Burrows, and Jo Swerling's Tony Award-winning musical.

• Latest Update: Bill Condon Will Direct New Movie Adaptation of Guys and Dolls (7/7/2021)

GYPSY

• Production Company: New Regency

• Screenplay: TBA

• Director: Amy Sherman-Palladino

• Cast: TBA

• A new film adaptation of Jule Styne, Stephen Sondheim, and Arthur Laurents' classic musical.

• Latest Update: Gypsy Film Back in Development with Marvelous Mrs. Maisel Creator Amy Sherman-Palladino (2/7/2019)

JEKYLL & HYDE

• Production Company: Lexicon, Bluestone Entertainment, Fezziwig Studios

• Screenplay: Alexander Dinelaris

• Director: TBA

• Cast: TBA

• A film adaptation of Frank Wildhorn and Leslie Bricusse's 1997 musical.

• Latest Update: A Movie Based on Frank Wildhorn's Jekyll & Hyde Musical Is in the Works (3/19/2019)

JOSEPH AND THE AMAZING TECHNICOLOR DREAMCOAT

• Production Company: Amazon Studios, The Really Useful Group, Scott Sanders Productions

• Screenplay: Daniel Goldfarb

• Director: Jon M. Chu

• Cast: TBA

• A film adaptation of Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice's musical based on the biblical story of Joseph.

• Latest Update: Jon M. Chu to Direct New Film Adaptation of Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat (4/12/2023)

THE KING AND I

• Production Company: Paramount Pictures, Temple Hill, Concord

• Screenplay: TBA

• Director: TBA

• Cast: TBA

• A new film adaptation of Richard Rodgers and Oscar Hammerstein II's Tony Award-winning musical.

• Latest Update: New The King and I Film Adaptation in the Works From Paramount (2/12/2021)

KISS OF THE SPIDER WOMAN

• Screenplay: Bill Condon

• Director: Bill Condon

• Cast: Jennifer Lopez

• A film adaptation of John Kander, Fred Ebb, and Terrence McNally's Tony Award-winning musical, based on the novel by Manuel Puig.

• Latest Update: Jennifer Lopez to Star in Kiss of the Spider Woman Movie Musical (12/7/2023)

MERRILY WE ROLL ALONG

• Production Company: Blumhouse

• Screenplay: Richard Linklater and Jonathan Marc Sherman

• Director: Richard Linklater

• Cast: Beanie Feldstein, Paul Mescal, Ben Platt, and Mallory Bechtel

• A film adaptation of the George Furth-Stephen Sondheim musical, filmed over 20 years to recreate the amount of time the show covers.

• Latest Update: Mallory Bechtel Joins Merrily We Roll Along Film Cast (2/6/2024)

ON YOUR FEET

• Production Company: Sony Pictures

• Screenplay: Lissette Feliciano

• Director: Lissette Feliciano

• Cast: TBA

• An adaptation of the musical about Emilio and Gloria Estefan.

• Latest Update: An On Your Feet! Movie Musical Is in the Works (4/25/2024)

ONCE ON THIS ISLAND

• Production Company: Walt Disney Studios, Marc Platt Productions

• Screenplay: Jocelyn Bioh

• Director: Wanuri Kahiu

• Cast: TBA

• An adaptation of the Lynn Ahrens and Stephen Flaherty musical.

• Latest Update: Film Adaptation of Once On This Island in the Works at Disney+ (7/30/2020)

OLIVER!

• Production Company: Walt Disney Studios, Cube Vision, Marc Platt Productions

• Screenplay: Danny Strong

• Director: Thomas Kail

• Cast: Ice Cube

• A new film adaptation of Lionel Bart's Tony Award-winning musical.

• Latest Update: Danny Strong to Pen Script for Disney’s Oliver! Remake, Directed by Hamilton’s Thomas Kail (1/18/2018)

PORGY AND BESS

• Production Company: MGM, Winkler Films

• Screenplay: Dee Rees

• Director: Dee Rees

• Cast: TBA

• An adaptation of George and Ira Gershwin, and DuBose and Dorothy Heyward's opera.

• Latest Update: Oscar Nominee Dee Rees to Helm New Porgy and Bess Movie (2/11/2020)

THE SHAGGS

• Production Company: In Cahoots

• Screenplay: Joy Gregory

• Director: Ken Kwapis

• Cast: Elsie Fisher

• An adaptation of Joy Gregory, John Langs, and Gunnar Madsen's musical The Shaggs: Philosophy of the World.

• Latest Update: Elsie Fisher Tapped to Star in Shaggs Film Musical (10/17/2018)

SHUCKED

• Production Company: Mandalay Pictures

• Screenplay: Robert Horn

• Director: TBA

• Cast: TBA

• A film adapatation of Brandy Clark, Shane McAnally, and Robert Horn's Tony-nominated musical.

• Latest Update: Shucked to Be Turned Into Feature Film (1/15/2024)
